Driftglobe

If you are within 60 feet of this sphere, you can speak its command word and cause it to emit light as the light or daylight spell. This property can\'t be used again until the next dawn.\n You can use an action to speak another command word and make the illuminated globe rise into the air and float no more than 1 foot above the ground. It hovers in this way until you or another creature grasps it. If you move more than 60 feet away from the globe, it follows you to remain within 60 feet of you. It takes the most direct route.\n If its movement is blocked, the globe descends gently to the ground, becomes inactive, and its light winks out.
Potion of Fire Breath

After drinking this potion, you can use a bonus action to exhale fire at a target within 30 feet of you. The target must make a DC 13 Dexterity saving throw, taking 4d6 fire damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. The effect ends after you have exhaled the fire three times or after 1 hour.
The potion\'s container holds a shimmering orange liquid, and wisps of smoke float on its surface each time it is opened.
Potion of Resistance

When you drink this potion, you gain resistance to one type of damage for 1 hour. The DM chooses the type or determines it randomly from the options below by rolling 1d10:

 1 - Acid
 2 - Cold
 3 - Fire
 4 - Force
 5 - Lightning
 6 - Necrotic
 7 - Poison
 8 - Psychic
 9 - Radiant
 10 - Thunder
Ammunition +1

Can be used as an arrow or a bolt.\nYou gain a bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this piece of magic ammunition. The bonus depends on the ammunition\'s rarity and is shown in the name. Once used, the ammunition ceases to be magical.
Ammunition +2
Ammunition +3
Acid Ammunition

Can be used as an arrow or a bolt.\nOn a hit, it explodes in a shower of acid, dealing your ranged weapon\'s damage + 2d4 acid damage. The target must make a DC 12 Constitution saving throw. On a failure, it suffers a -2 penalty to AC for 1 turn.\nAlternatively, it can be used as an area attack by making a DC 10 check. On a success, the acid coats a 7-foot-radius area, and anyone inside suffers a -2 penalty to AC until they leave the affected area.
It corrodes and disfigures everything it touches.
Fire Ammunition

Can be used as an arrow or a bolt.
On a hit, it releases a burst of fire, dealing your ranged weapon's damage + 2d4 fire damage. The target must make a DC 12 Constitution saving throw. On a failure, it starts burning and takes 1d4 fire damage at the start of each of its turns until the flames are extinguished.
 Alternatively, it can be used by shooting a flammable surface, making a DC 10 check. On a success, that surface (and anyone within it) catches fire, taking 1d4 fire damage at the start of each of its turns until the fire is extinguished.
 A creature can use its action to make a DC 10 Dexterity check and extinguish the flames. On a success, the damage ends.
Although it gives off no heat, the tip of this arrow will scorch any flesh it touches.
Ice Ammunition

Can be used as an arrow or a bolt.\nOn a hit, it releases a burst of ice, dealing your ranged weapon\'s damage + 2d4 cold damage. The target must make a DC 12 Constitution saving throw. On a failure, it takes a -2 penalty to its attack rolls and its speed is halved for 1 turn.\n Alternatively, it can be used as an area attack by making a DC 10 check. On a success, the ice covers a 7-foot-radius area. The ice is difficult terrain, and creatures that move across it must make a DC 12 Dexterity saving throw or fall prone.
Vapor curls around the arrowhead like breath on a winter day.
Lightning Ammunition

Can be used as an arrow or a bolt.\nOn a hit, it releases a burst of lightning, dealing your ranged weapon\'s damage + 2d4 lightning damage. This extra damage then chains to targets that are within 7 feet of each other.
Thin threads of electricity crawl across the arrowhead as soon as it is nocked.
Stunning Ammunition

Can be used as an arrow or a bolt.
This ammunition is fitted with a rounded, heavy tip that deals bludgeoning damage instead of piercing damage. It is designed to bring enemies down without killing them. If a creature is reduced to 0 hit points by this ammunition, it falls unconscious instead of dying.
 Undead and constructs are immune to this effect (but still take the damage).
This ammunition tends to break when used.

Each projectile ends in a rounded head, with a lead core wrapped in hardened leather. The finish is dull and heavy, with no edge at all, and the shaft bears signs of use and a faint oily patina. On impact, the tip crushes and stuns rather than piercing: a blow meant to drop, not to kill.\n It is an improved version of the ammunition used in training yards, which usually deals half damage.
Alchemist\'s Fire

As an action, you can throw this flask up to 30 feet, or up to 60 feet with disadvantage, shattering it on impact.
 If you throw it at a creature, make a ranged attack against the target, treating the alchemist's fire as an improvised weapon. On a hit, the target takes 2d6 fire damage immediately and 1d6 fire damage at the start of each of its turns until the fire is extinguished.
 If you use it as an area attack, make a DC 10 check. On a success, the fire covers a 10-foot-radius area. Affected creatures must make a DC 13 Dexterity saving throw; on a failure they take 1d4 fire damage. Regardless of the save, affected creatures catch fire and take 1d4 fire damage at the start of each of their turns until the fire is extinguished.
 A creature can use its action to make a DC 10 Dexterity check and extinguish the flames. On a success, the damage ends.
Shapes swirl and gleam behind the glass—liquid embers folding into one another.\n This sticky, adhesive fluid ignites when exposed to air.
Potion of Animal Friendship
After drinking this potion, you can cast the animal friendship spell (save DC 13) at will for 1 hour.
Shaking this cloudy liquid reveals tiny bits inside: a fish scale, a hummingbird tongue, a cat claw, or a squirrel hair.

When you drink this potion, your Strength score changes to 21 for 1 hour. The potion has no effect if your Strength is equal to or greater than that score.
The potion\'s liquid is clear, with a tiny sliver of a giant\'s fingernail from the appropriate type.

When you drink this potion, you gain the effect of the "enlarge" portion of the enlarge/reduce spell for 1d4 hours (no concentration required).
In the container, the potion\'s red constantly expands to stain the liquid around it, then contracts back into a small bead. Shaking the bottle doesn\'t disrupt this process.
Potion of Water Breathing
You can breathe underwater for 1 hour after drinking this potion.
A cloudy green fluid that smells of the sea, with a jellyfish-shaped bubble floating within.
Oil of Slipperiness

The oil can cover a Medium or smaller creature and the equipment it wears and carries. Additional vials are required for each size category above Medium. Applying the oil takes 10 minutes. The affected creature gains the effects of the freedom of movement spell for 8 hours.\n Alternatively, you can use an action to pour the contents of the vial onto the ground, covering a 10-foot-by-10-foot area of oil and replicating the effects of the grease spell for 8 hours.
This black, sticky ointment looks thick and heavy in the container, but flows quickly when poured.
Dust of Disappearance

There is enough for one use. When you use an action to throw the dust into the air, you and each creature and object within 10 feet of you become invisible for 2d4 minutes. The duration is the same for all affected, and the dust is consumed when the magic takes effect.\nIf a creature affected by the dust attacks or casts a spell, the invisibility ends for that creature.
This dust, found in small packets, resembles very fine sand.
Dust of Sneezing and Choking

There is enough for one use. When you use your action to throw a handful of dust into the air, all creatures that need to breathe within 30 feet of you, including you, must succeed on a DC 15 Constitution saving throw or be unable to breathe while sneezing uncontrollably. A creature affected in this way is incapacitated and choking. While it remains conscious, it can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on a success. The lesser restoration spell can also end this effect.\n The dust appears to be dust of disappearance, and an identify spell reveals it as such.
This dust, kept in a small container, resembles very fine sand.
Elemental Gem - Red Corundum
When you use an action to crush it, it summons a fire elemental as if you had cast conjure elemental, and the gem\'s magic is lost.
This gem contains a mote of fire elemental energy.
Elemental Gem - Yellow Diamond
When you use an action to crush it, it summons an earth elemental as if you had cast conjure elemental, and the gem\'s magic is lost.
This gem contains a mote of earth elemental energy.
Elemental Gem - Blue Sapphire
When you use an action to crush it, it summons an air elemental as if you had cast \'conjure elemental\', and the gem\'s magic is lost.
This gem contains a mote of air elemental energy.
Elemental Gem - Emerald
When you use an action to crush it, it summons a water elemental as if you had cast \'conjure elemental\', and the gem\'s magic is lost.
This gem contains a mote of water elemental energy.
Philter of Love

You become charmed for 1 hour by the next creature you see within 10 minutes after drinking this philter. If the creature is of a gender and species you would normally find attractive, you regard it as your true love while you remain charmed.
The effervescent, pink-tinted liquid of this potion contains a hard-to-spot bubble shaped like a heart.
Cap of Water Breathing

If you are underwater while wearing this cap, you can use an action to speak its command word and create a bubble of air around your head. It allows you to breathe normally underwater. The bubble stays with you until you speak the command word again, remove the cap, or are no longer underwater.
Cloak of the Manta Ray
While wearing this cloak with the hood up, you can breathe underwater and you have a swimming speed of 60 feet. Pulling the hood up or down requires an action.
Goggles of Night
While wearing these dark lenses, you have darkvision out to 60 feet. If you already have darkvision, these goggles increase its range by 60 feet.
Helm of Comprehending Languages
While wearing this helm, you can use an action to cast the \'comprehend languages\' spell from it at will.
Mithral Armor

Any medium armor (except hide) or heavy armor can be made of mithral.\n If the armor normally imposes disadvantage on Dexterity (Stealth) checks or has a Strength requirement, the mithral version doesn\'t.\n The armor\'s value is that of the normal armor + 800 gp.
Mithral is a flexible, lightweight metal.
Potion of Poison

If you drink it, you take 3d6 poison damage and must succeed on a DC 18 Constitution saving throw or become poisoned. While poisoned in this way, you take 3d6 poison damage at the start of each of your turns. You can make a DC 13 Constitution saving throw at the end of each of your turns. On a success, the poison damage you take on subsequent turns is reduced by 1d6. The poison ends when the damage is reduced to 0.

This concoction looks, smells, and tastes like a potion of healing or any other beneficial potion. However, it is actually a poison masked by illusion magic. The \'identify\' spell reveals its true nature.
Antidote
If you drink it, it neutralizes all poisons.
This mixture is almost chewable, it\'s so thick with herbs and roots.
Ring of Swimming
You have a swimming speed of 40 feet while wearing this ring.
Saddle of the Cavalier
While sitting in this saddle on a mount, you can\'t be dismounted against your will if you\'re conscious, and attacks against the mount have disadvantage.
Wand of Magic Detection
While holding it, once per day you can use an action to cast the \'detect magic\' spell from it. The wand can be used again at dawn.
Wand of Secrets

While holding it, once per day, you can use an action and, if there is any trap or secret door within 30 feet of you, the wand vibrates and points to the nearest one. The wand can be used again at dawn.
Potion of Diminution
When you drink this potion, you gain the "reduce" effect of the \'enlarge/reduce\' spell for 1d4 hours (no concentration required).
In the container, the potion\'s red continuously contracts into a small bead, then expands to stain the liquid around it. Shaking the bottle doesn\'t disrupt this process.

When you drink this potion, you gain the effect of the \'gaseous form\' spell for 1 hour (no concentration required) or until you end it using a bonus action.
The bottle seems to contain a mist that moves and sloshes like water.
Potion of Heroism
When you drink this potion, you gain 10 temporary hit points that last for 1 hour. For the same duration, you are also under the effect of the \'bless\' spell (no concentration required).
This blue potion bubbles and steams as if it were boiling.
Potion of Invulnerability
For 1 minute after you drink this potion, you have resistance to all damage.
The thick, syrupy liquid of this potion looks like liquid iron.
Potion of Mind Reading
When you drink this potion, you gain the effect of the \'detect thoughts\' spell (save DC 13) for 1 hour.
The dense purple liquid of this potion has an ovoid pink cloud floating above it.
Elixir of Health
When you drink this potion, it cures any disease afflicting you and removes the "blinded", "deafened", "poisoned", and "paralyzed" conditions.
Tiny bubbles of light can be seen suspended in the pale red liquid in the vial.
Bead of Force

You can use an action to throw the bead to a point within 60 feet of you, making a DC 10 Dexterity check. It explodes on impact and is destroyed.\nEach creature within 10 feet of the point where it explodes must succeed on a DC 15 Dexterity saving throw or take 5d4 force damage. Creatures that succeed on the saving throw take half as much damage and are pushed directly away from the bead\'s point of impact until they are completely out of the area.\n Any creature that failed the saving throw and was entirely within the area has its speed reduced to half for 1 minute.
This small black sphere is 3\/4 of an inch in diameter and weighs 1 ounce.
Eyes of Minute Seeing

While wearing these lenses, you can see much better than normal to a distance of 1 foot. You have advantage on Intelligence (Investigation) checks that rely on sight while searching an area or studying an object within that range.
These crystal lenses cover the eyes.
Horseshoes of Speed
While four of them are affixed to the hooves of a horse or similar creature, its walking speed increases by 30 feet.
These iron horseshoes come in sets of four.
Periapt of Health

While wearing this pendant, you are immune to common diseases and to certain minor magical diseases, such as swamp fever, sewer plague, or cackle fever. This item offers no protection against powerful curses or afflictions of divine origin.
Sending Stones

A sending stone is always linked to another. When you touch one stone, you can use an action to cast the \'sending\' spell from it. The target is the bearer of the other stone. If no one is bearing the other stone, you know that as soon as you use the stone and the spell isn\'t cast.\n Once \'sending\' has been cast, the pair can\'t be used again until the next dawn. If one of the stones in the pair is destroyed, the other one becomes nonmagical.
These polished stones come in pairs, each one carved so that its mate is easily identifiable.
Potion of Invisibility
When you drink it, you become invisible for 1 hour. Anything you wear or carry is invisible with you.\n The effect ends if you attack or cast a spell.
The bottle of this potion appears empty, yet it somehow seems to contain liquid.
Potion of Speed
When you drink this potion, you gain the effect of the \'haste\' spell for 1 minute (no concentration required).
The yellow liquid of this draught has black streaks and swirls within it.
Oil of Sharpness

You can coat one slashing or piercing weapon or up to 5 pieces of slashing or piercing ammunition. It takes 1 minute to apply this oil. For 1 hour, the coated weapon is considered magical and has a +3 bonus to attack and damage rolls.
This clear, gelatinous oil gleams from the tiny silver shards suspended within it.
Potion of Flying

Drinking this potion grants you a flying speed equal to your walking speed for 1 hour.\n If you are in the air when the potion\'s effect ends, you fall unless you have some other means of staying aloft.
The liquid of this potion floats at the top of the vial, streaked with white cloudlike impurities.
Potion of Vitality

When you drink it, this potion removes any exhaustion you are suffering and cures any minor disease or poison affecting you. For the next 24 hours, you regain the maximum number of hit points for any Hit Die you spend.
The crimson liquid of this draught pulses steadily with a dim light, like a heartbeat.
Horseshoes of a Zephyr

While four of them are affixed to the hooves of a horse or similar creature, they allow it to move normally, but it floats 4 inches above the ground. This effect means the creature can cross or stand on nonsolid or unstable surfaces, such as water or lava. In addition, it leaves no tracks and ignores difficult terrain. Finally, it can move at normal speed for up to 12 hours per day without suffering exhaustion from a forced march.
These iron horseshoes come in sets of four.
Arrow of Slaying

An arrow of slaying is a magic weapon designed to kill a particular type of creature. For example, there are arrows of slaying for dragons, giants, mind flayers, and so on.\n If a creature of the type, race, or group associated with an arrow of slaying takes damage from one, it must make a DC 17 Constitution saving throw. It takes an extra 6d10 piercing damage on a failed save, or half as much extra damage on a successful one.\n Once an arrow of slaying deals its extra damage to a creature, it becomes a nonmagical arrow.
Other similar kinds of ammunition exist, such as crossbow bolts of slaying, though arrows are the most common.
